text:
Our mission is to
improve human-wellness

by re-imagining the data
present in human stool.

We look to empower individuals
through the everyday use

of a toilet to unlock
personal information about how
to live a better life.

My name is Sonia Grego, I am
a physicist and the Co-founder

of Coprata We are part
of a team developing
the smart-sampling toilet.

A technological leap
in the management
of chronic GI diseases.

We as clinicians depend heavily
on patient self-reporting
of bowel movement.

But that is subjective
and often inaccurate.

Stool analysis is
a valuable tool.

However, stool kits
have a low return rate
and that is problematic.

Coprata's toilet
system automatically

samples and analyzes stool
at indicated intervals.

And also, discreetly
measures stool properties
with every bowel movement.

Coprata has patent coverage
and a working prototype
for this technology.

It's exciting to be able
to share more about where
we're going with Coprata.

We've had great conversations
with industry leaders about how

we can partner and develop
the remote patient monitoring

space, as well as the GI
virtual care environment.

We have allies in place as
we continue human testing.

We have a path for FDA
clearance and good conversations
about reimbursement.

In terms of, how we're going
to deliver cost savings.

We see a true impact
that we're going to have

and are excited to bring
others along on the journey.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
